channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: フランスの日曜紙「ラ・トリビューヌ・ディマンシュ」創刊の様子。唯一の日曜紙「ル・ジャーナル・デュ・ディマンシュ」が極右新聞に変貌している。
item.description:
Angelique Chrisafis / The Guardian:
A look at the launch of the French Sunday newspaper La Tribune Dimanche as the only other Sunday paper Le Journal du Dimanche is turned into a far-right outlet  —  La Tribune Dimanche goes on sale in landscape of declining print sales, culture wars and scrutiny of billionaire proprietors

item.title: 情報源フロリダ政治』創刊者ピーター・ショーシュ氏、政治家に無記名記事を買わせ、広告料を払う選挙運動の要請で報道を歪曲（NPR）
item.description:
NPR:
Sources: Florida Politics founder Peter Schorsch lets politicians buy unlabeled stories and distorts coverage at the behest of campaigns that pay for ads  —  This story was reported by NPR's David Folkenflik and Miranda Green of Floodlight, a nonprofit newsroom that investigates the powerful interests stalling climate action.

item.title: アマゾンのアレクサは、ランブルとサブスタックの情報源を引用して2020年の選挙が盗まれたと主張していたが、アマゾンは誤りを修正したと発表した（Cat Zakrzewski/Washington Post）
item.description:
Cat Zakrzewski / Washington Post:
Amazon's Alexa has been claiming that the 2020 election was stolen citing sources from Rumble and Substack; Amazon says the errors were fixed  —  The popular voice assistant says the 2020 race was stolen, even as parent company Amazon promotes the tool as a reliable election news source — foreshadowing a new information battleground

item.title: ニューヨーク・パブリック・ラジオが20人のスタッフを解雇、スタジオ部門から2つのポッドキャストをカット、さらに3人のスタッフが希望退職（Max Rivlin-Nadler/hellgatenyc）
item.description:
Max Rivlin-Nadler / hellgatenyc:
New York Public Radio lays off 20 staff members and cuts two podcasts from its studio division; three additional staffers took voluntary buyouts  —  “It is not a good use of any of our time, looking in the rearview mirror and trying to figure out where we should place blame," New York Public Radio's CEO told staff on Friday.

item.title: BBCは、OpenAIなどがデータをスクレイピングするのを阻止したが、ジャーナリズムの研究や制作を含め、ジェネレーティブAIの利用を模索する予定だと述べている（Emilia David/The Verge）。
item.description:
Emilia David / The Verge:
The BBC says it blocked OpenAI and others from scraping its data, but plans to explore using generative AI, including for journalism research and production  —  The BBC, the UK's largest news organization, laid out principles it plans to follow as it evaluates the use of generative AI …

item.title: アライアンス・バーンスタインインドにおけるNetflixの加入者数は〜650万人、Prime Videoは2000万人、Disney+ Hotstarは4000万人以上、Netflixの伸び悩みはローカルコンテンツの不足が原因（Manish Singh/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Manish Singh / TechCrunch:
AllianceBernstein: Netflix has ~6.5M subscribers in India, Prime Video has 20M, and Disney+ Hotstar has 40M+; Netflix's slow growth due to lack of local content  —  Netflix has “not succeeded” in scaling up its business in India despite the global streaming giant consistently lowering …

item.title: 情報筋ディズニーがインド資産の買い手候補と交渉中、ゴータム・アダニ氏や放送会社サンテレビのカラニティ・マラン会長ら (Bloomberg)
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Disney is in talks with potential buyers for its Indian assets, including Gautam Adani and Kalanithi Maran, chairman of broadcasting company Sun TV  —  - US group weighing outright sale, joint venture, other options  — Early discussions have also been held with Ambani's Reliance

item.title: デリー警察は告訴状で、シャオミ、ビボ、その他の中国企業がニュース配信会社ニューズクリックへの違法送金に手を貸したと非難している（ロイター）。
item.description:
Reuters:
In a complaint, the Delhi police accuse Xiaomi, Vivo, and other Chinese companies of helping transfer funds illegally to news outlet NewsClick  —  Indian police have formally accused Chinese smartphone makers Xiaomi Corp and Vivo Mobile of helping transfer funds illegally …

item.title: 獄中のイラン人ジャーナリストで人権活動家のナルゲス・モハマディが、イランにおける女性抑圧との闘いで2023年のノーベル平和賞を受賞（Fatima Al-Kassab/NPR）
item.description:
Fatima Al-Kassab / NPR:
Jailed Iranian journalist and human rights activist Narges Mohammadi won the 2023 Nobel Peace Prize for her fight against the oppression of women in Iran  —  This year's Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Iranian human rights activist and journalist Narges Mohammadi.

item.title: ピッツバーグの新聞社社員が、ブロック・コミュニケーションズ傘下のピッツバーグ・ポスト・ガゼット紙とのストライキ1周年を記念して集会を開いた（Tori Yorgey/WTAE）
item.description:
Tori Yorgey / WTAE:
Pittsburgh newspaper employees rally to mark the one-year anniversary of their ongoing strike against Block Communications' Pittsburgh Post-Gazette  —  Rally to be held Friday afternoon  —  Friday marked one year since workers at the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette walked out of their workplace and onto the picket line.

item.title: ネバダ州最高裁は、殺害されたジェフ・ジャーマン記者の端末を警察の捜査から保護し、第三者が彼の報道資料を捜査するよう求めた（Katelyn Newberg/Las Vegas Review-Journal）
item.description:
Katelyn Newberg / Las Vegas Review-Journal:
The Nevada Supreme Court protects murdered reporter Jeff German's devices from police searches, calling for a third party to search his journalistic materials  —  The Nevada Supreme Court has moved to protect slain Las Vegas Review-Journal investigative reporter Jeff German's personal devices …

item.title: カナダの遺産相、オンラインニュース法に反対する大企業にもかかわらず「引き下がらない」と発言；グーグルは「重大な構造的問題」が残っていると発言（フランス通信社）
item.description:
Agence France-Presse:
Canada's heritage minister says the country “will not back down” despite Big Tech opposing the Online News Act; Google says “critical structural issues” remain  —  Canada “will not back down” in the face of opposition from tech giants to a new law requiring companies …

item.title: 超法規的殺人を擁護するなど、ドナルド・トランプの攻撃的な言葉はほとんど注目されない。
item.description:
Paul Farhi / Washington Post:
Donald Trump's increasingly aggressive words, like advocating for extrajudicial killings, get little attention, as the media still doesn't know how to cover him  —  After eight years of Trump in politics, is a ‘banality of crazy’ setting in?  —  Last week, the Republican Party's leading …

item.title: ニューズクリック記者逮捕後、18のメディア団体がインド最高裁長官に言論の自由を支持し、警察によるメディア脅迫を終わらせるよう介入するよう要請（The Wire）
item.description:
The Wire:
After NewsClick journalists were arrested, 18 media groups urge India's chief justice to uphold free speech and intervene to end the police's media intimidation  —  'The developments over the past 24 hours have left us no option but to appeal to your good conscience to take cognisance …

item.title: 米国のヒスパニック系／ラテン系成人2,637人を対象とした調査：2023年には過去最高の38％が毎月ポッドキャストを聴くようになる。
item.description:
Edison Research:
Survey of 2,637 US Hispanic/Latino adults: a record 38% are monthly podcast listeners in 2023, up from 25% in 2020, rising nearly 4X faster than all US adults  —  Latino Podcast Listeners Engage with Ads as Listening Grows … Monthly podcast listenership among Latinos increased by 52% since 2020 …
